title: Derek Jones (Canadian football)
text:
Derek Jones (born May 22, 1992) is a Canadian former professional <a href="Canadian%20football">football</a> who was a <a href="defensive%20back">defensive back</a> in the <a href="Canadian%20Football%20League">Canadian Football League</a> (CFL). He was drafted 29th overall in the fourth round of the <a href="2014%20CFL%20Draft">2014 CFL Draft</a> by the <a href="Winnipeg%20Blue%20Bombers">Winnipeg Blue Bombers</a>. On February 11, 2020, he signed a two-year contract with the <a href="BC%20Lions">BC Lions</a>. He played <a href="college%20football">college football</a> for the <a href="Simon%20Fraser%20Clan%20football">Simon Fraser Clan</a>, and retired from football on June 23, 2021.
His father, <a href="Ed%20Jones%20%28defensive%20back%29">Ed Jones</a>, played in the CFL for nine years and won five <a href="Grey%20Cup">Grey Cup</a> championships with the <a href="Edmonton%20Eskimos">Edmonton Eskimos</a>.
